summary: This document is a letter from Anjan Sahni, an attorney representing JPMorgan Chase, to Alison Moe, an Assistant United States Attorney, regarding the submission of account documentation in response to grand jury subpoenas. The letter requests confidential treatment for the materials submitted and outlines the legal basis for such a request under the Freedom of Information Act.

persons.name: Alison Moe
persons.context: Alison Moe is addressed in the letter as the recipient of the correspondence regarding the grand jury subpoenas.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.context: Anjan Sahni is the author of the letter, representing JPMorgan Chase in the matter concerning the grand jury subpoenas.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is mentioned in relation to account documentation submitted by JPMorgan Chase as part of the grand jury subpoenas.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell is mentioned alongside Jeffrey Epstein in relation to account documentation submitted by JPMorgan Chase.

connections.description: Anjan Sahni is representing JPMorgan Chase in legal matters related to the grand jury subpoenas.
Jeffrey Epstein is identified as a client of JPMorgan Chase, with account documentation referenced in the letter.
Ghislaine Maxwell is also identified as a client of JPMorgan Chase, with account documentation referenced in the letter.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoenas Issued
events.description: Grand jury subpoenas were issued to JPMorgan Chase Bank and its affiliates.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoenas Issued

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoenas Issued

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York
keyFacts: The letter is a response to multiple grand jury subpoenas issued to JPMorgan Chase.
Account documentation related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell is included in the submission.
JPMorgan Chase is requesting confidential treatment for the materials submitted under FOIA exemptions.
The letter emphasizes the potential competitive harm to JPMorgan if the materials are disclosed.
Anjan Sahni is the attorney representing JPMorgan Chase in this matter.
